definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: wise after the event (idiom); with hindsight, one should have predicted it
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
see 聰明一世，糊塗一時|聪明一世，糊涂一时[cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2]
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , meng3 dong3 yi1 shi2

definition: even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

sentences.english: The clever thing was to break the rules and stay alive all the same .
sentences.chinese: 聪明的做法，是把规矩破得巧，同时又得活得好。

sentences.english: The Stegosaurus had a very small brain and was not smart.
sentences.chinese: 剑龙的脑袋非常小，所以不太聪明。

sentences.english: What makes my brother think he's so smart?
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥凭什么认为自己是那么聪明？

sentences.english: Very well written, the book is packed with clever ideas and fascinating information.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有很好的文笔，聪明的想法以及有趣的信息。

sentences.english: The bright young man can get ahead quickly in the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 这位聪明的年轻人在旅游业界很快获得成功。

sentences.english: Mypricemap is a smart shopping tool for all shoppers.
sentences.chinese: 比翻天是一个让消费者聪明购物的工具。

sentences.english: Can you imagine how much smarter this is going to make you look?
sentences.chinese: 能想像这会让你看上去比以前聪明了多少吗？

sentences.english: You're here to corrupt one of my brightest and best.
sentences.chinese: 你来这里是想带坏我最聪明和最好的学生。

sentences.english: "What about me?" brayed the donkey. "I thought I was the cleverest. "
sentences.chinese: “那我呢？”驴子叫道，“我觉得我才是最聪明的。”

sentences.english: This adage says that even a clever person may do something stupidly.
sentences.chinese: 是说聪明人也有一时糊涂做错事的时候。

sentences.english: I have discovered a brilliant trick.
sentences.chinese: 我发现了一个聪明的招数。

sentences.english: I think of it as searching smarter.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这使搜索更聪明，更体贴。

sentences.english: He looked very intelligent, I must say, when he said that.
sentences.chinese: 我必须得承认，他看起来太聪明了，当他说。

sentences.english: Maybe the intelligent person ain't so smart after all?
sentences.chinese: 可能，难道这个有才智的人并不聪明？

sentences.english: He's so clever, he makes me feel inferior.
sentences.chinese: 他是那么聪明，使我自愧不如。

definition: clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
to do what one is told/obedient
